text: Dramatic scenery and good cinematography. Feels like Eric Bana and Anna Torv were a bit underutilized in this movie. Could have been so much more, but not at all a total disaster. Some good and convincing moments, albeit few and far between.

A disappointing so-called sequel to The Dry(which I rated as 4 stars). The script was lazy and clunky and the cinematography hardly took advantage of the dramatic landscape. Eric Bana and Anna Tove did the best they could considering the poor direction and script of this underwhelming movie.
Just as good or even better than The Dry. Hoping and wishing for The Dry 3🤞

Eric Bana torna nei panni del detective Falk in un'indagine che, esattamente come nel primo film, sfrutta molto bene le location, che diventano essenziali e centrali nello sviluppo di tutta la trama.
La sceneggiatura riesce abilmente a mantenere dubbio il finale e a nascondere i colpevoli sfruttando l'ampia gamma di personaggi per rendere il tutto più imprevedibile e meno noioso.
Purtroppo alcuni personaggi risultano un po' forzati nel dimostrare le loro (poche) caratteristiche finendo per essere poco spontanei e creando qualche crepa nei dialoghi.
Eric Bana invece continua sulla falsa riga del primo capitolo con un personaggio integerrimo e serio, senza grandi scatti emotivi che lo rendono molto interessante e perfino leggermente misterioso.
Purtroppo il finale sulla cascata è totalmente sbagliato, sia per credibilità della sceneggiatura che per la finta location trovata.
Comunque un giallo thriller ben costruito.

It was a big disappointment after the first film. The book has a lot of praise, so I'm not sure what went wrong in this sequel.  While the actors did a great job, I guess I didn't really care for the characters or mystery?  The first film explored trauma, buried secrets, and the prisons we build for ourselves.   But I’m not sure what The Dry 2 film was trying to say...
Not as good as the first , but still a worthy crime mystery. Would love a third.

Honestly, this was one of the less likely sequels I’d have ever expected. The ‘twists’ and reveals came as no surprise because as I was watching it I thought there was no way they could twist this and make it interesting... and I was right.  The main chracter's involvement felt watered down and far less central to the plot than the predecessor, and the duality of the story did not mesh together as well as it did in the first film.  I guess we’ll have to wait and see how it all fits in to The Dry extended universe.

Bunch of different personalities, a missing person and many other entanglements sets up this thriller on a good foundation. An unfortunate mishap within a grand scheme that brings famous detective Falk into this Australian wilderness much damper than the previous instalment. Totally different circumstances but the conclusion is satisfactory could have been even better. Rich visuals of the greenery at last connects to Falks final statement of how nature reclaims no matter what we occupies our lives with all affairs are benath it. Great sound effects. Excellent performances by the cast. And this is another great instalment for Aaron Falk's adventures.
